alert.note: Alert for Forsyth (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 15 at 8:06AM EST until December 15 at 7:04PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed to Minor severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Georgia... Big Creek at GA 9 near Cumming affecting Forsyth County. For the Big Creek...including Cumming...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding will continue. * WHERE...Big Creek at GA 9 near Cumming. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 7 feet, Minor flooding continues to expand into the natural flood plain of the creek upstream and downstream from the gage at Atlanta Highway or Georgia Highway 9. Large portions of the sidewalk and boardwalk of the Big Creek Greenway will be flooded. The areas under the Georgia 400 Highway and McFarland Road will be covered with around two feet of water. A portion of the sidewalk under Majors Road will be covered with around 3 feet of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM EST Thursday the stage was 6.9 feet and rising slowly. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:45 AM EST Thursday was 6.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling to 5.3 feet late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 6 feet. &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
